description: From Latin hesternus (“of or pertaining to yesterday; yesterday’s”) + English -al (suffix forming adjectives). Hesternus is derived from herī (“yesterday”) (ultimately from Proto-Indo-European *dʰǵʰyés (“yesterday”)) + -ter (suffix forming adverbs) + -nus (suffix forming nouns).

entries.meaning: (archaic or literary, rare outside grammar) Of or pertaining to yesterday.
